Crime_Type: Human Rights Violations and Serious International Law Offenses
Legal_Provision_Involved: Section 6(1) of the Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable delay in approving transfer despite U.S. approval
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review, disclosure of materials, cost award
Legal_Framework: Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms, Transfer of Offenders Act
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness of government delay under constitutional standards
Evidence_Requirement: Documentation of U.S. approval, timeline of Canadian government actions
Decision_Outcome: In favor of applicant; rights violated, disclosure ordered, costs awarded
Institutional_Action: Delayed approval by Canadian authorities for nearly a decade
Exemptions_or_Defenses_Cited: Security concerns, administrative justifications for delay
Evidence_Type: Official correspondence, legal filings, procedural records
Individual_Status_or_Claim: Canadian citizen incarcerated in the U.S.
Nature_of_Participation: Applicant seeking transfer under international treaty mechanism
Personal_Data_Implicated: Citizenship status, incarceration details, transfer eligibility
Legal_Statute: Transfer of Offenders Act, Canadian Charter of Rights and Freedoms
Assessment_Standard: Whether delay constituted reasonable limit under s. 6(1)
Complaint_Issues: Violation of mobility rights due to prolonged detention abroad
Legal_Standard: Section 6(1) Charter protection of mobility rights
Protection_Claim: Right to return to Canada as a citizen
State_Protection_Assessment: State failed to uphold constitutional rights during transfer process
Risk_Factor: Prolonged incarceration in foreign prison system
Credibility: Not challenged; based on documented governmental delay
Targeted_Group: Transferring offenders who are Canadian citizens
State_Protection_Adequacy: Found inadequate due to unjustified delay
Risk_Nature: Legal and human rights risk from extended extraterritorial detention
Enforcement_Action: Declaration of rights violation, order for disclosure and costs
Perpetrator_Entity: Canadian government authorities responsible for transfer approval
Legal_Basis: Charter of Rights and Freedoms, international transfer agreement
Victim_Basis: Individual deprived of mobility rights due to state inaction
